metadata.description: Basketball tactics with descriptions, classified by offense, defense, and other

offense.name: 1-3-1 Offense
offense.description: One point guard at the top, three wing players on the perimeter, and one center at the baseline. Creates scoring opportunities through movement and screens.

offense.name: 5 Man Weave
offense.description: A warm-up drill that becomes an offensive pattern where all five players weave through each other while passing the ball.

offense.name: Back Screen
offense.description: An off-ball player sets a screen from behind to help a teammate cut to the basket.

offense.name: Blocker-Mover Offense
offense.description: Two post players focus on screening (blockers) while the other three players constantly move (movers) to create scoring chances.

offense.name: Continuity Offense
offense.description: Continuous screening, passing, and movement that creates a repeating offensive pattern.

offense.name: Death Lineup
offense.description: A small-ball lineup with five versatile players who can all shoot, pass, and defend multiple positions.

offense.name: Dribble Drive Motion
offense.description: Uses aggressive drives and kick-outs to generate three-pointers or layups at the rim.

offense.name: Fast Break
offense.description: Quick transition after a defensive stop, pushing the ball up court before the defense can set up.

offense.name: Flex Offense
offense.description: Players run through baseline screens and down screens to create cutting and shooting opportunities.

offense.name: Four Corners Offense
offense.description: Four players spread to the four corners of the frontcourt while the point guard controls the tempo with the ball.

offense.name: Gravity (Basketball)
offense.description: The concept of how shooters and ball-handlers attract defensive attention, creating space for teammates.

offense.name: Jump Shot (Basketball)
offense.description: A fundamental offensive skill where a player shoots while airborne, creating separation from defenders.

offense.name: Motion Offense
offense.description: Players continuously move and pass, using screens and cuts to create shooting opportunities.

offense.name: Pace and Space
offense.description: Modern basketball philosophy that creates opportunities through fast pace and floor spacing.

offense.name: Pick and Pop
offense.description: After setting a screen, the screener pops out to the perimeter for a jump shot.

offense.name: Pick and Roll
offense.description: The most common offensive tactic where a screen creates opportunities for shooting or driving.

offense.name: Player Tracking (National Basketball Association)
offense.description: Technology that tracks player movement and statistics to analyze offensive and defensive effectiveness.

offense.name: Princeton Offense
offense.description: An offensive system emphasizing passing, movement, and reading the defense.

offense.name: Run and Gun (Basketball)
offense.description: A fast-paced offensive style focused on quick transitions and rapid shooting.

offense.name: Shuffle Offense
offense.description: An offensive system that uses continuous screens and cuts to create scoring chances.

offense.name: Slasher (Basketball)
offense.description: A player who excels at driving to the basket and finishing at the rim.

offense.name: Small Ball (Basketball)
offense.description: Using a smaller, faster lineup to increase pace and floor spacing.

offense.name: Triangle Offense
offense.description: Phil Jackson's classic offensive system emphasizing triangular player positioning and passing.

offense.name: UCLA High Post Offense
offense.description: John Wooden's high post offensive system emphasizing ball movement and player rotation.

offense.name: Wheel Offense
offense.description: An offensive system where players rotate around the basket in a circular motion.

defense.name: 1-2-1-1 Zone Press
defense.description: Full-court press with one player up front, two at mid-court, one at backcourt, and one at the baseline.

defense.name: 1-3-1 Defense
defense.description: Zone defense with one player at the top, three across the middle, and one at the baseline.

defense.name: 2-3 Zone Defense
defense.description: Zone defense with two players at the top and three players near the baseline.

defense.name: Box-and-One Defense
defense.description: Four players play zone defense while one player man-marks the opponent's key scorer.

defense.name: Full-Court Press
defense.description: Applying defensive pressure across the entire court to force turnovers.

defense.name: Hack-a-Shaq
defense.description: Intentionally fouling a poor free-throw shooter to force them to shoot free throws.

defense.name: Jordan Rules
defense.description: A defensive strategy using multiple defenders to trap and pressure a superstar player.

defense.name: Line Defense
defense.description: A defensive formation where players align in a straight line to cover passing lanes.

defense.name: Man-to-Man Defense
defense.description: Each defensive player is responsible for guarding a specific offensive player.

defense.name: Match-up Zone Defense
defense.description: A hybrid defensive system combining elements of man-to-man and zone defense.

defense.name: Triangle-and-Two Defense
defense.description: Three players play zone defense while two players man-mark the opponent's key scorers.

defense.name: Zone Defense
defense.description: Defensive system where players guard specific areas rather than specific opponents.

other.name: Grinnell System
other.description: An extreme uptempo offensive system emphasizing three-pointers and full-court pressure.

other.name: Nellie Ball
other.description: Don Nelson's small-ball tactics emphasizing speed and three-point shooting.
